text:
<http://status.aws.amazon.com/|Informational message: Network Connectivity>
We are investigating network connectivity issues for some instances within the US-EAST-1 Region.

<http://status.aws.amazon.com/|Informational message: Network Connectivity>
Between 11:27 AM and 11:28 AM some instances experienced connectivity issues for network traffic between Availability Zones within the US-EAST-1 Region. The issue was automatically mitigated and we continue to monitor all affected instances.

<http://status.aws.amazon.com/|Informational message: Increased provisioning and registration times>
We are investigating increased provisioning and back-end target registration times for load balancers within the US-EAST-1 Region. Connectivity to existing load balancers is not affected.

<http://status.aws.amazon.com/|Service is operating normally: [RESOLVED] Network Connectivity>
Between 11:27 AM and 11:28 AM PDT some instances experienced connectivity issues for network traffic between Availability Zones within the US-EAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

<http://status.aws.amazon.com/|Informational message: Network Connectivity>
Between 11:28 AM and 11:31 AM PDT some Multi-AZ and Single-AZ RDS instances experienced network connectivity issues in the US-EAST-1 Region. All affected Multi-AZ RDS instances failed over to a second Availability Zone, which restored connectivity. The majority of the Single-AZ RDS instances have recovered and we continue to work on restoring connectivity to a small number of remaining Single-AZ RDS instances.

<http://status.aws.amazon.com/|Service is operating normally: [RESOLVED] Network Connectivity>
Between 11:28 AM and 11:31 AM PDT some Multi-AZ and Single-AZ RDS instances experienced network connectivity issues in the US-EAST-1 Region. All affected Multi-AZ RDS instances failed over to a second Availability Zone, which restored connectivity. The remaining Single-AZ RDS instances have now restored connectivity. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

<http://status.aws.amazon.com/|Informational message: Increased Error Rates>
We are experiencing increased API error rates and delayed group scaling in the US-EAST-1 Region. Connectivity to existing EC2 Instances is not affected.

<http://status.aws.amazon.com/|Informational message: Increased provisioning and registration times>
We continue to work on resolving the increased provisioning and back-end target registration times for Classic and Application Load Balancers within the US-EAST-1 Region. Provisioning and back-end target registration times are not affected for Network Load Balancers. Connectivity to all load balancers is not affected.

<http://status.aws.amazon.com/|Service is operating normally: [RESOLVED] Increased provisioning and registration times>
Beginning at 11:50 AM PDT we experienced increased provisioning times for Classic and Application Load Balancers within the US-EAST-1 Region. At 12:40 PM PDT, registration times for new back-end targets began to increase. At 2:05 PM PDT, both load balancer provisioning and back-end target registration latencies began to recover. By 2:25 PM PDT, back-end target registration times had returned to normal levels and by 2:44 PM PDT load balancer provisioning had fully recovered. Connectivity to...

<http://status.aws.amazon.com/|Informational message: Increased Error Rates>
We have identified the root cause of the increased API error rates and delayed group scaling in the US-EAST-1 Region. We are beginning to see recovery and continue to work toward full resolution.

<http://status.aws.amazon.com/|Service is operating normally: [RESOLVED] Increased Error Rates>
Between 11:28 AM and 4:05 PM PDT we experienced increased API error rates and delayed group scaling in the US-EAST-1 Region. Connectivity to existing EC2 Instances is not affected. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.
